installer_type.description: Which type of installer generated this ping (full or stub)

installer_version.description: Version of the installer itself. May be different from the product version for a stub install.

build_channel.description: Channel the installer was built with the branding for

update_channel.description: Value of MOZ_UPDATE_CHANNEL the installer was built with. Generally the same as build_channel

version.description: Version of the installed product. May be different from installer_version for a stub install. Absent for a failed stub installation.

build_id.description: Build ID of the installed product. Absent for a failed stub installation.

locale.description: Locale of the installer and the installed product, in AB_CD format

from_msi.description: True if the install was launched from an MSI wrapper

64bit_build.description: True if the installed build is 64-bit

64bit_os.description: True if the OS this installer ran on is 64-bit

os_version.description: Windows version number in major.minor.build format

server_os.description: True if the OS this installer ran on is Windows Server

admin_user.description: True if the user account which ran the installer had administrative privileges

default_path.description: True if the user did not customize the installation path

set_default.description: True if the option to set the new installation as the default browser was selected

new_default.description: True if the new installation was successfully set as the default browser

old_default.description: True if an existing Firefox installation was already set as the default browser

had_old_install.description: True if at least one existing installation of Firefox was found on the system prior to this installation

old_version.description: Version of the previously installed Firefox, if any

old_build_id.description: Build ID of the previously installed Firefox, if any

bytes_downloaded.description: Size of the full installer data that was actually transferred

download_size.description: Expected size of the full installer download according to the HTTP response

download_retries.description: Number of times the full installer download was retried or resumed

download_time.description: Seconds spent downloading the full installer

download_latency.description: Seconds between sending the full installer download request and receiving the first response data

download_ip.description: IP address of the server the full installer was downloaded from. May be either IPv4 or IPv6.

manual_download.description: True if the user clicked through the error message to the manual full installer download page.

intro_time.description: Seconds spent on the intro screen

options_time.description: Seconds spent in the options screens. For the stub installer this includes only the profile cleanup prompt.

preinstall_time.description: Seconds spent verifying the downloaded full installer and preparing to run it

install_time.description: For a stub ping, seconds the full installer ran for. For a full ping, seconds spent on the install progress page.

finish_time.description: For a stub ping, seconds spent waiting for the installed application to launch. For a full ping, seconds spent on the finish page.

succeeded.description: True if a new installation was successfully created. If false, check the error status fields for the failure reason.

disk_space_error.description: True if the installation failed because the drive we're trying to install to does not have enough space

no_write_access.description: True if the installation failed because the user doesn’t have permission to write to the path we’re trying to install to.

user_cancelled.description: True if the installation failed because the user cancelled it or closed the window

out_of_retries.description: True if the installation failed because the download had to be retried too many times (currently 10)

file_error.description: True if the installation failed because the downloaded file couldn’t be read from

sig_not_trusted.description: True if the installation failed because the signature on the downloaded file wasn’t valid and/or wasn’t signed by a trusted authority

sig_unexpected.description: True if the installation failed because the signature on the downloaded file didn’t have the expected subject and issuer names

install_timeout.description: True if the installation failed because running the full installer timed out. Currently that means it ran for more than 150 seconds for a new installation, or 165 seconds for a paveover installation.

new_launched.description: True if the installation succeeded and we were able to launch the newly installed application.

old_running.description: True if the installation succeeded and we weren’t able to launch the newly installed application because a copy of Firefox was already running.

attribution.description: Any attribution data that was included with the installer

profile_cleanup_prompt.description: Which type of profile cleanup prompt was shown, (reinstall or paveover)

profile_cleanup_requested.description: True if either profile cleanup prompt was shown and the user accepted the prompt

ping_version.description: Only set for stub installer pings
